Article Title: Google shuts down search Notes experiment after short run
Article Text:
The Notes experiment offered two functionalities:

Google is wrapping up its short-lived "Notes" experiment within Google Search . Launched last November, the feature allowed users to leave public or private notes on specific search results, aiming to create a platform for user-generated insights and discussions.* Public Notes: Users could leave comments and annotations directly on search results, potentially offering supplementary information or alternative perspectives.* Private Notes: Users could create personal notes tied to specific search results, serving as a personal reference point for future searches.Despite its initial ambitions, the Notes experiment reportedly failed to gain significant traction with users"Search Labs is our testbed for bold experimentation, and as we've shared, not all experiments will launch broadly. We're excited to continue testing new ways to connect people to authentic, relatable voices and look forward to bringing some of our learnings from Notes into future product experiences,” said the company.While the Notes experiment is ending, Google emphasises its commitment to user-centric search experiences . The company will likely continue exploring ways to leverage user insights and potentially integrate them into future search functionalities.
Article Summary: Google is wrapping up its short-lived "Notes" experiment within Google Search. Launched last November, the feature allowed users to leave public or private notes on specific search results. Despite its initial ambitions, the Notes experiment reportedly failed to gain significant traction.

Article Title: Why FIFA’s search of ‘new deal’ for Club World Cup may be ‘bad news’ for Apple
Article Text:
Apple’s connection with Club World Cup streaming and problems for FIFA

Apple ’s reported billion dollar deal with FIFA to secure worldwide streaming rights for the Club World Cup tournament next year may have been scrapped. According to a report by New York Times-owned The Athletic, FIFA is searching for broadcasters for streaming the revamped FIFA Club World Cup in the Americas, Asia and the Middle East & North Africa regions.This means that the reported deal, which would have given Apple TV+ exclusive access to broadcast the month-long event featuring some of the biggest club teams from across the globe, is effectively ending. The expanded men’s Club World Cup is set to take place in the US from June 15 to July 13, 2025 and then in 2029.Through a newly-launched tender, FIFA is aiming to find multiple broadcasters to secure commitments for specific regions. The governing body said that this tender process will allow them “to select the entity, or entities, that are best placed to secure the required transmission and programming commitments on a global, regional, or territory-specific basis”. The deadline for submitting bids is August 20.In April, reports suggested Apple was close to securing a $1 billion global streaming deal for the Club World Cup, with an announcement anticipated soon. However, earlier this month, it was claimed that the deal had either collapsed or was more “proposed” than “deal” in the first place.It was previously claimed that the $1 billion amount is far less than the $4 billion FIFA had initially sought. This is because there weren’t many takers of the deal at that price, with a person familiar with the broadcast industry reportedly saying that a major US media company estimated the value of competition’s streaming rights in North America at around $30 million.Moreover, people familiar with the process told the publication that FIFA faced difficulties in enticing traditional broadcasters to invest heavily in the Club World Cup. Major names like NBC, the broadcaster of the English Premier League, and Fox Sports, which holds the FIFA World Cup rights, reportedly opted out of bidding.Secondly, with a deal providing global streaming rights via Apple TV+ would have aligned with Apple’s strategy of offering exclusive content to drive subscriptions for Apple TV+. However, this drew criticism from Ricardo Fort, a former head of global sponsorships at Visa, a FIFA partner. He argued that a global sporting event behind a subscription service may well serve fans in wealthier countries but it would be a barrier for many others.“For a global event, a great new tournament where they should be thinking about how to build interest and awareness around the world, a subscription-based product is not ideal, assuming the only access is by paying Apple," Fort said. Notably, the company secured a $2.5 billion deal over a decade for exclusive global access to MLS in 2022.A single broadcaster approach stands in stark contrast to the traditional model favoured by major sporting events. Typically, broadcast rights are fragmented and sold across various markets to maximise reach and revenue. For instance, the Premier League has sold rights to 40 companies in 97 countries for the current cycle (2022-2025).
Article Summary: FIFA is searching for broadcasters for streaming the revamped FIFA Club World Cup in the Americas, Asia and the Middle East & North Africa regions. This means that the reported deal, which would have given Apple TV+ exclusive access to broadcast the month-long event featuring some of the biggest club teams from across the globe, is effectively ending. The deadline for submitting bids is August 20.

Article Title: Microsoft cuts jobs in DEI team; laid-off leader criticises move in an email sent to thousands of employees
Article Text: Microsoft has eliminated an internal team focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), citing "changing business needs," according to a recent report by Business Insider.The layoffs , which took effect on July 1, have sparked controversy within the company.The move comes despite Microsoft's previous commitments to improve diversity efforts, including a pledge made in 2020 to double the number of Black and African-American leaders within the company by 2025.The current progress on this initiative remains unclear.However, a leader of the disbanded team has expressed strong criticism of the decision in an email sent to thousands of Microsoft employees, as he suggests that the team is no longer critical for the company. "True systems-change work associated with DEI programs everywhere are no longer business critical or smart as they were in 2020," the team leader wrote, as reported by Business Insider.Microsoft spokesperson Jeff Jones stated that the company's diversity and inclusion commitments remain unchanged. "Our focus on diversity and inclusion is unwavering and we are holding firm on our expectations, prioritising accountability, and continuing to focus on this work," Jones said in a statement to Business Insider.This reduction in DEI staff aligns with a broader trend in the tech industry. Companies like Zoom , Google , and Meta have also reportedly cut back on their diversity programs in recent months.The layoffs are part of Microsoft's annual workforce adjustments, which typically occur around the start of its fiscal year. However, the company has been conducting more frequent rounds of job cuts recently, including a significant reduction of 10,000 employees announced in early 2023.
Article Summary: Microsoft has eliminated an internal team focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) The layoffs took effect on July 1, and have sparked controversy within the company. A leader of the disbanded team expressed strong criticism of the decision in an email sent to thousands of Microsoft employees.

Article Title: How this technology may have helped FBI access locked phone of Trump's shooter in two days
Article Text:
What software helped FBI access the shooter’s phone

Previous phone-cracking incident

Two days after the assassination attempt on former US President Donald Trump , the Federal Bureau of Investigation ( FBI ) announced that they had “gained access” to the shooter's phone. The agency did not reveal how they managed to break into the device or what information they discovered. However, the rapid success suggests the use of advanced phone-hacking tools .“FBI technical specialists successfully gained access to Thomas Matthew Crooks’ phone, and they continue to analyse his electronic devices,” the FBI said, without mentioning the name and model of the phone. The agency, however, failed in its first attempt to break into the shooter’s phone.According to a report by The Verge, when field agents in Pennsylvania failed to ‘crack’ the phone, the FBI sent it to its lab in Quantico, Virginia where they took the help of security researchers to break into the phone.The publication cited Cooper Quintin, a security researcher and senior staff technologist with the Electronic Frontier Foundation, saying that the law enforcement agencies possess tools to extract data from phones.“Almost every police department in the nation has a device called the Cellebrite , which is a device built for extracting data from phones, and it also has some capability to unlock phones,” Quintin was quoted as saying.Cellebrite, an Israel-based company, provides mobile device extraction tools (MDTFs) to law enforcement. The report noted that these tools come from various vendors and offer different capabilities for extracting data from mobile devices. Their efficacy – how well they work – can vary significantly. It's likely the FBI has its own internal forensics tools developed specifically for their needs.“It seems reasonable to me that the field office there [in Pennsylvania] wouldn’t have some of the more advanced techniques for breaking into modern phones that they have at Quantico,” Quintin said, adding that he had “little doubt that Quantico will be able to break into this phone”.In a previous case, the FBI had demanded that Apple unlock an iPhone of the shooter in the San Bernardino shooting case in 2016. However, the company refused, saying that it cannot create a backdoor.“The FBI may use different words to describe this tool, but make no mistake: Building a version of iOS that bypasses security in this way would undeniably create a backdoor. While we believe the FBI’s intentions are good, it would be wrong for the government to force us to build a backdoor into our products. And ultimately, we fear that this demand would undermine the very freedoms and liberty our government is meant to protect,” Apple CEO Tim Cook said at that time.The FBI later dropped the case because it got help from an “outside source” to break into the device.
Article Summary: Federal Bureau of Investigation announced that they had ‘gained access’ to the shooter’s phone. The agency did not reveal how they managed to break into the device or what information they discovered. However, the rapid success suggests the use of advanced phone-hacking tools.

Article Title: Microsoft hiring of AI startup's founder and key employees under scanner: What makes governments worried
Article Text:
What makes governments worried about AI mergers

What Microsoft said on the hiring

Microsoft Corp's investment in Inflection AI (artificial intelligence) is facing a full-blown antitrust investigation in the UK, according to Bloomberg, with regulators scrutinizing the hiring of a significant number of the startup's employees, reports Bloomberg.Microsoft hired Mustafa Suleyman as well as Inflection’s Chief Scientist and co-founder Karén Simonyan, along with most of the startup’s employees earlier this year.The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has announced the launch of a formal phase one merger probe into the partnership. The agency has a deadline of September 11 to decide whether to escalate the investigation to a more in-depth phase, Bloomberg reports.This move by the CMA comes amidst concerns that big tech companies are strategically investing in AI startups to stifle competition, according to Bloomberg. The agency has observed a pattern of large tech firms acquiring or investing in AI startups, potentially to control and influence the development of this nascent field.The CMA has previously used its merger control powers to assess similar deals, but in the case of Microsoft's investment in Mistral AI, the agency determined Microsoft did not gain enough control to influence Mistral's commercial activities, reports Bloomberg.The Microsoft-Inflection deal, however, appears to be structured differently. While Microsoft did pay Inflection $650 million, primarily to license its AI software, the key aspect was the hiring of a substantial portion of the startup's staff, according to a source familiar with the arrangement, as reported by Bloomberg.Governments in some countries are said to have become concerned about how the biggest technology companies are gobbling up the talent and products of innovative AI startups without formally acquiring them. According to a report by news agency AP, three members of the US Senate recently wrote to antitrust enforcers at the Justice Department and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC), urging them to investigate Amazon's deal with San Francisco-based Adept. The deal will result in Adept's CEO and key employees going to Amazon and giving the e-commerce giant a license to Adept's AI systems and datasets.Microsoft maintains that "hiring talent promotes competition and should not be treated as a merger," and is prepared to cooperate with the CMA's investigation, reports Bloomberg. This isn't an isolated incident. The report said that Amazon.com has also been actively recruiting talent from AI startups, including key executives and employees from Adept AI Labs.In a separate move seen as an attempt to avoid regulatory scrutiny, Microsoft recently abandoned plans to take board roles at OpenAI. Regulators in both the US and Europe had expressed concerns about Microsoft's potential influence over OpenAI. The CMA is yet to decide on whether to launch a probe into the OpenAI investment.
Article Summary: Microsoft Corp's investment in Inflection AI is facing a full-blown antitrust investigation in the UK. The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has announced the launch of a formal phase one merger probe into the partnership. The agency has a deadline of September 11 to decide whether to escalate the investigation to a more in-depth phase.

Article Title: Apple gives 6 reasons to use Safari over Google Chrome on iPhones, Macs
Article Text:
How browsing generally works and users tracked online

Privacy on iPhone | Flock | Apple

Here’s how Safari addresses common tracking methods

Cross-site tracking prevention

Hides IP address from known trackers

Location data protections

Privacy-preserving web extensions

Blocks known trackers in Private Browsing

Removes unique trackers from URLs in Private Browsing

Apple is making a major push for user privacy with Safari browser. The company has detailed features that keeps users safe while they use Safari in their day to day life. For this, the company has launched a campaign highlighting six key areas where their browser protects user privacy. These include combating cross-site tracking , shielding location data, securing extensions, and offering enhanced Private Browsing with link protection.The campaign is launched as the Apple released iOS 18 public beta and macOS Sequoia public beta.Apple released a short video hinting at how web tracking works on browsers and how they may leave users vulnerable. It highlights that ‘other’ browsers follow users’ activity across websites, building a profile without their knowledge.They can expose location which means that data companies can pinpoint users’ location without permission. Not only websites, some extensions can access users’ data, compromising privacy. It also highlights that private browsing in other browsers may not fully protect users..Apple says with Safari, users get cross-site tracking blocked, essentially stopping companies from following them across the web. There’s location control where users decide when websites access their location. Thirdly, there is a choice of privacy-first extensions and finally, Safari offers advanced private browsing.Apple says that since the data companies are constantly evolving new techniques to track users, it created an Intelligent Tracking Prevention feature that uses machine learning to learn which domains are used to track users. It then isolates and purges the tracking data from the device. Intelligent Tracking Prevention is on by default when you use Safari.Safari also hides users’ IP address from known trackers. This is important because an IP address can be used to identify a user across websites and sessions, which can reveal the user’s precise location.Apple says Safari also combats fingerprinting – techniques to figure out who you are and where you browse. System configuration, fonts, plug-ins and even the screen resolution can be used as part of a fingerprint. A simplified version of the system configuration on Apple products makes it hard for trackers to single one out, it noted.Apple notes that Safari helps protect location data, which is another way that websites and data companies try to track users. To keep users in control, Safari does not share location data with any search engine. In cases where users need to provide location information, such as looking for places nearby, Safari gives users granular control by prompting ‘to share or not share’ data, or even choose “remember my decision for one day," to limit how long the website can use your location.Apple says that some extensions in other browsers can track what is on users’ screens. Safari, on the other hand, informs users about the information the extension can access before they enable it.Private Browsing in Safari doesn’t save the web pages that users have visited, the searches that have been made, or AutoFill information. Apple is also making these protections even stronger with Face ID and Touch ID.When users browse the web, they may notice that some links have added extra information to track you. Safari removes those links or unnecessary trackers appended to URLs that are shared in Messages and Mail, the company explained. This also works when browsing in Safari Private Browsing.
Article Summary: Apple is making a major push for user privacy with Safari browser. The company has detailed features that keeps users safe while they use Safari in their day to day life. These include combating cross-site tracking, shielding location data, securing extensions, and offering enhanced Private Browsing with link protection.

Article Title: How Google’s reported biggest-ever acquisition may help it better compete with Microsoft, Amazon
Article Text:
How Wiz acquisition will help Google and problems it may face

More about Wiz, the US-Israeli cybersecurity company

Google's parent company, Alphabet, is reportedly negotiating to buy cybersecurity startup Wiz for a hefty $23 billion. This would be Alphabet 's largest acquisition ever. The deal isn't finalised yet, but if it goes through, Google could gain a significant advantage in competing against cloud giants Microsoft and Amazon Web Services (AWS).Experts believe the deal will strengthen Google's cloud security offerings for large companies, which is reportedly a prime target for hackers.“There is a hot market for cloud security,” Jerome Seguera, a senior intelligence analyst at the cybersecurity firm MalwareBytes, told news agency Reuters. Seguera added that Wiz gives customers “great visibility into their assets in a straightforward way” by offering tools that allow businesses to scan their infrastructure and specific software for threats.Moreover, by acquiring Wiz's technology, Google may look to gain an edge against cloud giants Amazon and Microsoft in the fight against growing ransomware threats. It should be noted that Alphabet acquired Mandiant two years ago for $5.4 billion.“I think they are trying to compete with Microsoft and to a smaller extent AWS (Amazon Web Services). Wiz is one of only a few who address a big chunk of the cloud security market in one platform," said Marc Bleicher, chief technology officer of the security firm Surefire Cyber.Wiz, a cybersecurity startup founded in 2020, capitalised on the pandemic-driven shift to remote work and cloud adoption. With a US-Israeli presence (headquarters in New York and engineering in Tel Aviv), the company is led by former Israeli intelligence veterans who previously founded another successful cloud security firm acquired by Microsoft.Wiz has experienced rapid growth, reaching a $12 billion valuation just two months ago, and is projected to hit $1 billion in annual revenue by 2025 with nearly $2 billion raised in venture capital.
Article Summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet, is reportedly negotiating to buy cybersecurity startup Wiz for a hefty $23 billion. This would be Alphabet's largest acquisition ever. If it goes through, Google could gain a significant advantage in competing against cloud giants Microsoft and Amazon Web Services.

Article Title: Chandigarh woman loses Rs 80 lakh to SIM card scam: Here’s what happened
Article Text:
How the scam unfolded?

How to check SIM cards registered on your Aadhaar Card?

Visit the TAFCOP website: https://tafcop.sancharsaathi.gov.in/telecomUser/

Enter your Mobile number in the given box

Next, enter the captcha and click on “request OTP.”

Enter the OTP you have received on your number and click on “Login.”

You will see a list of mobile numbers registered on your ID.

Check and ensure that all the active mobile numbers belong to you or to your relatives

In case of any doubt, this website gives 03 options; “Not my number”, “Not required” and “Required”.

You can report a number that is registered with your ID and does not belong to any of your family members by clicking “Not my number”.

A Chandigarh resident lost Rs 80 lakh after she received a call from fraudsters posing as a police officer. The caller told her that a SIM card in her name was allegedly being used in illegal activities. The victim, fearing arrest, agreed to the caller’s demand and transferred the money, reports Tribune India.A case has been registered with the cybercrime police station.The victim is a resident of sector 11, Chandigarh. She told police that she received a call from a person who pretended to be a police officer with the Crime Branch in Mumbai. The caller told her that a SIM card issued against her Aadhaar card was used in illegal money laundering activities.The fraudster asserted that they have received 24 money laundering complaints against her, further threatening her with an arrest. Fearing arrest, the victim followed the caller’s direction who demanded Rs 80 lakh which was to be returned if the woman was found innocent.The woman eventually transferred Rs 80 lakh to ‘clear the case’, only to realize later that she had been scammed.The Department of Telecommunication (DoT) launched a web portal called Telecom Analytics for Fraud Management & Consumer Protection or TAFCOP to check SIM cards issued under one ID. Here’s how to do it
Article Summary: A Chandigarh resident lost Rs 80 lakh after she received a call from fraudsters posing as a police officer. The caller told her that a SIM card in her name was allegedly being used in illegal activities. The victim, fearing arrest, agreed to the caller’s demand and transferred the money.

Article Title: Apple iPhone 16 series: Expected launch date, camera features and other specs
Article Text:
Apple iPhone 16 series expected software features



Apple iPhone 16 series expected design

Apple iPhone 16 series expected display

Apple iPhone 16 series expected camera

Apple ’s next-generation iPhone series – iPhone 16 is expected to debut in September later this year. The iPhone 16 lineup, like previous years, is expected to offer four smartphones – iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus , iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max. The upcoming iPhone series is rumoured to come with design and camera upgrades.The 2024 iPhones will run on iOS 18 operating system that was announced in June this year.The comparatively ‘affordable’ iPhones - iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Plus are likely to be powered by A18 Bionic chipset. The Pro models - iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max, on the other hand are tipped to come equipped with A18 Pro processor.With the upcoming iPhone 16 series, Apple is rumorued to bring back the vertically-aligned camera modules. The latest iPhone series features a horizontally-aligned camera setup. The Cupertino-based company is also expected to drop traditional physical buttons with capacitive, touch-sensitive buttons that simulate the feel of pressing a real button.Additionally, the Action Button present on iPhone 15 Pro models is rumoured to come with the standard and plus models this year– iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Plus.The iPhone 16 series is also rumoured to feature bigger screen displays for the Pro models. Apple iPhone 16 and 16 Plus may retain the display size of 6.1-inch and 6.7-inch, but could see a jump in the refresh rate. The iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max, on the other hand, are tipped to come with a bigger screen size of 6.3-inch and 6.9-inch.The Apple iPhone 16 series may come with camera upgrades. Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo tips that Apple may bring the tetraprism lens, previously exclusive to the iPhone 15 Pro Max, to iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max. The tetraprism lens on new iPhones is tipped to offer a 5x zoom capability.
Article Summary: Apple’s next-generation iPhone series – iPhone 16 is expected to debut in September later this year. The iPhone 16 lineup, like previous years, is expected. to offer four smartphones - iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16pro Max. The upcoming iPhone series is rumoured to come with design and camera upgrades.

Article Title: Motorola Edge 50 Fusion review: Feature rich smartphone at competitive price
Article Text:
3.5/5

Design

Display

Performance

Camera

Battery

Verdict

Motorola expanded its Edge series in India recently with the launch of Motorola Edge 50 Fusion . Over the years, Motorola’s Edge series smartphones have become popular for their design and performance in terms of camera and display. The Edge 50 Fusion is no exception. It features a vegan leather texture on the rear and premium-looking colours.The smartphone runs Qualcomm Snapdragon 7s Gen 2 processor and comes with a starting price of Rs 22,999 (base variant).Motorola Edge 50 Fusion packs a host of features like Dolby Atmos surround sound, AI-powered shot optimization and audio zoom. We used the device for sometime and here’s our reviewWith the vegan leather back, Motorola Edge 50 Fusion gives a premium tactile experience. The smartphone is offered in three colour options – Forest Blue, Marshmallow Blue and Hot Pink. We got the Marshmallow Blue variant for review which looks good and further adds to the premiumness of the device.The leather back gives a sturdy hand grip of the Edge 50 Fusion without worrying for any scratches and dust. Motorola ships a pantone inspired cover with the phone. While Motorola provides a complimentary back cover, it's worth noting that it might slightly affect the phone's grip and feel.Motorola Edge 50 Fusion comes with curved edges on the front. There is a punch-hole display camera at the front. While the rear has a dual camera setup with large sensors aligned vertically. The LED flash light is placed beside the sensors.Weighing 175 grams, Motorola Edge 50 Fusion is a comparatively lightweight device. Left edge of the phone features three buttons – volume increase and decrease button placed above the power button. The bottom edge houses the Type-C port along with speakers, microphone and SIM tray slot.Overall, the smartphone looks premium for its price with a subtle design and colour. Having said that, we recommend using a back cover with the phone as it tends to get dirty easily.Motorola Edge 50 Fusion has a 6.67-inch full HD screen with 144Hz refresh rate and 2400x1080p resolution. The display is good with satisfactory colour production. However, the display lacks support for HDR. Nevertheless, the viewing experience is decent with deep contrast and punchy colours.The smartphone features adaptive brightness and adjusts itself as per the surrounding light. We did not face any issue while using the phone outdoors. Another feature worthy of mentioning is the edge lighting on Motorola Edge 50 Fusion that lights up the edges while receiving a notification or a call.The handset is also equipped with another feature called flicker prevention. Enabling it prevents the screen from flickering in dark environments. The phone is said to offer up to 600 nits of peak brightness which can be adjusted as well.Motorola Edge 50 Fusion comes powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 7s Gen 2 chipset with 4nm process. The smartphone has an octa-core CPU with four high-performance Arm Cortex-A78 cores clocked at 2.4Ghz speed. It is paired with four power-efficient Cortex-A55 cores at a clock speed of 1.95GHz. For graphics, Motorola Edge 50 Fusion has Adreno 710 GPU. The device was able to efficiently handle day-to-day tasks. We did not face any noticeable lag in the daily performance of the device. The handset can handle moderate gaming, though it tends to heat up during prolonged gaming sessions.Motorola Edge 50 Fusion packs up to 12GB RAM and up to 256GB internal storage capacity. The smartphone runs on Android 14 based Motorola’s Hello UI skin on the top. The phone has a comparatively clean UI with no third-party apps. Although you will find some Motorola’s own system apps. The company is giving three major Android OS updates with the phone in addition to four years of security patch, which is good if you are looking to buy a smartphone for prolonged years.One thing that got us worried was that the display, at times, does not immediately wake up when tapped on the locked screen.Coming to the audio of the Motorola Edge 50 Fusion, we really liked the sound quality. Equipped with Dolby Atmos surround sound, it manages to deliver an immersive audio experience. The handset also boasts of Spatial Audio which works with compatible media contents only. Users can also customize the audio settings for music, gaming, movies or podcasts. There is also a smart audio feature that identifies the content and performs automatic adjustments. You can also connect your smartphone to your TV and select advanced settings for the connected device.Motorola Edge 50 Fusion also has a Live Caption feature. Once enabled, it can detect speech on the device and automatically generate captions. The feature is available with a software update.Motorola Edge 50 Fusion has a dual camera setup on the back. There is a 50MP Sony Lytia700 C main sensor paired with a 13MP ultra-wide secondary sensor. During our review, we found the images to be slightly oversaturated with enhanced colours and contrast. Images captured using the phone are generally warm with a yellowish tint.The main sensor supports optical image stabilization (OIS) which reduces motion blur in the images. Photos captured in low-light are decent. There is enough detail in the image without any unnecessary noise.The 13MP ultra-wide camera gives a satisfactory performance in capturing wide-angle shots. For selfies and video calls, the phone has a 32MP camera at the front with f/2.4 aperture. Selfies captured by Motorola Edge 50 Fusion are good. The images do not look artificial. There is a slight skin tone correction, but not to the extent that it deviates from reality. The phone struggles to capture photos in the indoor artificial lighting using the front camera. Though no such issue was faced for outdoor images.The UI of the camera app is easy to navigate through. Camera features like portrait, slow motion, Pro mode and others are available right on the screen. So you don’t have to struggle to find them. We noticed that there is a lack of depth in the portrait shots with not satisfactory image detection.Motorola Edge 50 Fusion is backed by a 5,000mAh battery. The company ships a 68watt charger inside the box with a USB Type-C to Type-C charging cable. The phone can easily last a full day easily on a single charge. It takes almost an hour to fully charge the device.Some of the battery features on the phone include adaptive battery that limit battery for apps that are not in use. There is also a charge boost that can optimize charging by increasing the charging speed. However, the phone tends to heat up with this feature. Battery safety features are optimized charging and overcharge protection.Motorola Edge 50 Fusion delivers a striking balance between performance, camera and design. Packed with mid-range Snapdragon processor, Sony camera sensor and vegan leather back, the smartphone ticks most boxes. At Rs 22,999, the company has carved out a niche for Motorola Edge 50 Fusion, offering compelling features at an affordable price tag.
Article Summary: Motorola Edge 50 Fusion has a 6.67-inch full HD screen with 144Hz refresh rate and 2400x1080p resolution. There is a punch-hole display camera at the front. While the rear has a dual camera setup with large sensors aligned vertically. The phone runs on Android 14 based Motorola’s Hello UI skin on the top.

Article Title: Apple iPhone users, government has a warning on these SMSes
Article Text:
Here’s what the post reads

New Transnational #Scam Alert:

#iPhone users are receiving scam messages via

iMessage

regarding package from random accounts. Clicking on suspicious links may be avoided and read receipts may be disabled for such suspicious messages.

What does the scam message read?

India Post:

Your package has arrived at the warehouse and we attempted delivery twice but were unable to due to incomplete address information. Please update your address details within 48 hours, otherwise your package will be returned. Please update the address in the link: https://indiapostsz.top/IN

After the update is completed we will re-deliver within 24 hours, India Post!

How to spot a fake scam message?

Apple iPhone users, have you received a message allegedly about an undelivered parcel at India post warehouse? If yes, then be warned. This is a new scam where fraudsters are sending fake messages to iPhone users about packages from random accounts.Cyber Dost – the cybersafety and cybersecurity awareness handle maintained by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India has warned Apple users against these new ‘ transnational scam ’ messages.It has shared a post on X (formerly Twitter) informing users and advising them not to click on suspicious links in these messages.With some patience and intelligence, it is possible to spot scam messages. In case you receive such a message, look for signs like urgency in taking an action, poor grammar in sentence formation, suspicious links and unusual sender’s address among others.
Article Summary: Fraudsters are sending fake messages to iPhone users about packages from random accounts. Government of India has warned Apple users against these new ‘ transnational scam ’ messages. Look for signs like urgency in taking an action, poor grammar in sentence formation, suspicious links and unusual sender’s address among others.

Article Title: Cognizant settles lawsuits against CFO and other execs filed by Wipro, pays $505,000 for settlement; read HR head's statement
Article Text: Cognizant CFO Jatin Dalal settled Wipro’s non-compete lawsuit for $505,087. Former Wipro SVP Mohammad Haque settled his lawsuit. Dalal’s arbitration occurred in Bengaluru City Civil Court. Wipro claimed Haque sent confidential files via Gmail before joining Cognizant as Senior VP. Wipro clarified actions weren’t personal. Dalal and Wipro's Saurabh Govil were satisfied with the confidential settlement.
Article Summary: Cognizant CFO Jatin Dalal settled Wipro’s non-compete lawsuit for $505,087. Former Wipra SVP Mohammad Haque settled his lawsuit. Dalal's arbitration occurred in Bengaluru City Civil Court.

Mukesh Ambani-owned Reliance Jio has announced a price increase for all its prepaid and postpaid plans, effective from today, July 3. The new tariff prices will be implemented across all touchpoints and channels. The most affordable plan, now priced at Rs 189, was previously Rs 155, marking a 22% rise. It's important to note that despite the price hike, the plan benefits such as call minutes and data allowance will remain unchanged.The telecom service provider has announced the price hike for 14 prepaid unlimited plans, 3 data add-on plans and 2 postpaid plans.Here’s a list of all the plans:The new tariff plans feature various price adjustments for popular monthly, bi-monthly, quarterly, annual, data add-on, and postpaid options. Monthly plans now range from Rs 189 to Rs 449 (increased from Rs 155 to Rs 399). Bi-monthly plans are priced between Rs 579 and Rs 629 for data ranging from 1.5GB/day to 2GB/day over 56 days. Quarterly plans are available from Rs 479 to Rs 1199, offering 6GB to 3GB/day over 84 days. Annual plans range from Rs 1899 to Rs 3599.Note that once the price hike goes into effect, the unlimited 5G data will only be available with plans offering 2GB/day data or above.
Article Summary: Reliance Jio announces price hike for 14 prepaid unlimited plans, 3 data add-on plans and 2 postpaid plans. Monthly plans now range from Rs 189 to Rs 449, with data offerings. Quarterly and annual plans also see adjustments. Telecom service provider ensures unchanged benefits amidst the price hike.

Article Title: Reliance Jio launches new gadget: Price, features and other details
Article Text:
JioTag Air features



JioTag Air price and availability

Reliance Jio has launched a new tracking device called the JioTag Air. Successor to last year’s JioTag, it comes with a host of new features. Unlike JioTag that worked only with the JioThings app, the JioTag Air is compatible with Apple Find My feature as well. Here are the details about Jio's new tracing deviceJioTag Air is a sleek asset tracker that allows you to find and track your valuables like keys, ID cards, wallets, purses, luggages, pets and other such items prone to misplacing and losing.It works with both iOS and Android devices. It is compatible with iPhones running iOS14 and above, and Android 9 and above.It is equipped with Bluetooth version 5.3 for wireless device tracking. The device has a built-in speaker and can be used to play loud sound of 90-120 db to locate lost items. As mentioned above, it works with both Apple Find My network and the JioThings app. However, a user can choose only one app at a time.Android users can pair with JioThings app and track the tagged item on this app itself. For Apple Users, once paired with Apple Find My app, JioTag Air sends continuous Bluetooth signals that can be detected by nearby devices in the Find My network like iPhones, iPads and Macs. These devices send the location of the JioTag Air to iCloud. Apple users can share tagged items on Apple Find My app with other Apple users. In addition, they can go to Apple’s Find My app and locate the item connected with the JioAirTag on map. Enabling Lost Mode will send automatic notifications to the paired Apple device when the lost item is detected in the Apple Find My network.JioTag Air is listed on the company’s website with a price of Rs 2,999 . But it can be purchased at Rs 1,499. It will be available in Blue, Red and Grey colour variants. Some of the bank offers listed on the site include cashback on payments using Paytm, CredUPI and select credit cards.JioAir Tag will also be available for purchase via JioMart, Reliance Digital and Amazon.
Article Summary: Reliance Jio has launched a new tracking device called the JioTag Air. It is a sleek asset tracker that allows you to find and track your valuables. It works with both iOS and Android devices and is compatible with Apple Find My feature. JioAir Tag will also be available for purchase via JioMart, Reliance Digital and Amazon.

Bharti Airtel has announced a price hike across all its prepaid and postpaid plans. Airtel's revised tariff plans will be effective from today, July 3. As announced by the company, it has increased the price of its entry-level plans by 70 paise, 'in order to eliminate any burden on budget challenged consumers.'It must be noted here that while the plans have become costlier, benefits like data, call minutes, etc remain the same.In total, Airtel has increased the price of 15 prepaid and postpaid plans. These prices apply to all circles, including Bharti Hexacom Ltd. Circles. Reliance Jio and Vodafone Idea have also increased their tariff rates by up to 22%.The revised tariff increases the price of Rs 179 monthly plan to Rs 199. The plan will continue to offer 2GB mobile data per day, unlimited calling and 100 SMS per day. Validity of the plan remains 28 days. Similarly, the annual plan of Rs 1,799 offering 2GB mobile data per day, unlimited calling and 100 SMSes every day will now cost Rs 1,999.Airtel's daily data add-on plans now come at Rs 22 onwards (a hike of Rs 3 from the previous Rs 19).Coming to Airtel's postpaid plans, the price now ranges from Rs 449 to Rs 1,199. Daily data plans offering up to 3GB data per day now come with starting price of Rs 265.
Article Summary: Bharti Airtel has increased the price of its monthly plan to Rs 199, offering 2GB data daily, unlimited calling, and 100 SMS per day. The annual plan now costs Rs 1,999 with the same benefits. These changes aim to support budget- constrained consumers while maintaining service quality.

Article Title: Why Lucknow SuperGiants 'shared' this Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma photo with Elon Musk
Article Text:
What Virat Kohli told PM Modi

Lucknow SuperGiants official X, formerly Twitter, account recently replied to a post from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk . In a post on X, Musk asked users to share beautiful content. Lucknow Super Giant's social media account replied to the same with a picture from the recent ICC T20 World Cup final, which was played between Indian and South Africa. The Indian team beat South Africa by 7-run to win the World Cup, which ended India's 13-year-long wait for an ICC World Cup trophy."Would be lovely to see more accounts on 𝕏 simply posting beautiful content x.com/evalovesdesign…," wrote Musk.Quoting this Elon Musk post, Lucknow SuperGiants replied, "Okay done 🥰," and along with these words shared the picture of Indian cricket team captain Rohit Sharma hugging star batsman Virat Kohli .These pictures of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma hugging are said to have broken the internet. The pictures shared on various social media platforms including X, Instagram and Facebook have got millions of likes.Talking about the hug at the felicitation ceremony, Kohli said "We have been playing for the last 15 years, this is the first time, I see Rohit so emotional - he was crying, I was crying, a hug between both of us - I will never forget that day." The felicitation function was organised by the BCCI at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.Kohli said that winning the T20 World Cup 2024 was a special moment for him as he had not realised the gravity of the moment when he was part of M.S Dhoni's team which won the 2011 ODI World Cup at this same venue. "I was 21-22 at that time and did not realise why the senior players were getting so emotional. After winning this World Cup, I have realised how special this is," said Kohli. He added that he had instantly realised that it was time for him to say goodbye to the format and make way for youngsters.During the Indian team's interaction with Prime Minister Narendra Modi at his residence on July 4, Kohli said, "We lived each ball at the end, we can't explain what was going on inside. We lost hope at one moment, then Hardik took a wicket and then with each ball, we got the energy. I am happy that I was able to contribute to the team in such a big game after a tough time. I won't be able to forget it. I was happy that I was able to take the team to a fighting total."
Article Summary: Lucknow SuperGiants official X, formerly Twitter, account recently replied to a post from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk. In a post on X, Musk asked users to share beautiful content. Lucknow Super Giant's social media account replied to the same with a picture from the recent ICC T20 World Cup final, which was played between Indian and South Africa.

Article Title: Prince William's boarding school bans smartphones, mandates Nokia phone for students
Article Text:
What does the school’s new policy on smartphone ban say?

UK government’s guidance on smartphone use by kids

In a major move, a posh boarding school in the UK has decided to swap its students’ smartphones for the classic Nokia phones, reports CBS News. The policy is based on guidelines from the UK government that allows school principals to enact smartphone bans on students during the school day.Eton College , the historic and elite British boarding school is located near the royal palace in Windsor. Prince William and Harry, Ian Fleming, Tom Hiddleston and novelist George Orwell are some of its notable alumni.As per the report, parents of first-year students at Eton College were informed about the changes in a letter. It reportedly said that the incoming 13-year-old boarders must transfer their SIM cards to offline Nokia phones given by schools. The phone will only be able to make phone calls and send text messages.The report quotes a school spokesperson who said “Eton routinely reviews our mobile phone and devices policy to balance the benefits and challenges that technology brings to schools.” He further added that those joining in Year 9, essentially the equivalent of freshman year in high school for American students, “will receive a 'brick' phone for use outside the school day, as well as a school-issued iPad to support academic study.”According to Ofcom, the UK government's communications regulator, 97% of children have their own smartphone phone by the age of 12. In the new guidelines issued in February this year, the government advised all schools to “have a behaviour policy which is aligned with the school’s legal duties and standards relating to the welfare of children. It further stated that boarding schools and residential schools should prohibit the use of mobile phones throughout the teaching day, among other things.
Article Summary: The policy is based on guidelines from the UK government that allows school principals to enact smartphone bans on students during the school day. Parents of first-year students at Eton College were informed about the changes in a letter. The incoming 13-year-old boarders must transfer their SIM cards to offline Nokia phones given by schools.

Article Title: Apple shares these 8 tips to protect your iPhone, iPad and Mac from online scams
Article Text:
What is a Social engineering scam?

Fraudulent emails and other messages that look like they're from legitimate companies, including Apple.

Misleading pop-ups and ads that say your device has a security problem.

Scam phone calls or voicemails that impersonate Apple Support, Apple partners, and other well known or trusted entities or individuals.

Fake promotions that offer free products and prizes.

Unwanted Calendar invitations and subscriptions.



How to protect your Apple account and devices

Never share personal data or security information like passwords or security codes, and never agree to enter them into a webpage that someone directs you to.

Protect your Apple ID. Use two-factor authentication, always keep your contact information secure and up to date, and never share your Apple ID password or verification codes with anyone. Apple never asks for this information to provide support.

password or verification codes with anyone. Apple never asks for this information to provide support. Never use Apple Gift Cards to make payments to other people.

Learn how to identify legitimate Apple emails about your App Store or iTunes Store purchases. If you send or receive money with Apple Cash (U.S. only), treat it like any other private transaction.

Learn how to keep your Apple devices and data secure.

Download software only from sources you can trust.

Don't follow links or open or save attachments in suspicious or unsolicited messages.

Don't answer suspicious phone calls or messages claiming to be from Apple. Instead, contact Apple directly through our official support channels.

Apple has shared crucial tips on how to recognize and avoid falling victim to scams like SMS threat, phishing and more. The iPhone maker has updated its security support document that provides tips to avoid scams and learn what to do if you receive suspicious emails, phone calls, or other messages.Apple says that scams like phishing and SMS threats are called social engineering scams - a type of targeted attack that relies on impersonation, deception, and manipulation to gain access to users’ personal data.The Cupertino-based company has also listed means that the scammers can use to trick victims into sharing information or giving them money. These include:Apple has also shared a few tips that a user can do to avoid scams that target Apple accounts and devices. These include
Article Summary: Apple has shared crucial tips on how to recognize and avoid falling victim to scams like SMS threat, phishing and more. iPhone maker has updated its security support document that provides tips to avoid scams and learn what to do if you receive suspicious emails, phone calls, or other messages.

Article Title: Google Fi protects users from SIM swaps with new “Number Lock" feature
Article Text:
How to activate the feature

Google Fi wireless has introduced a security feature called ‘ Number Lock ’. This new feature empowers users to take control and prevent a growing cybersecurity threat – SIM swapping .SIM swapping occurs when a malicious actor convinces your carrier to transfer your phone number to a new SIM card in their possession. This can grant them access to your calls, texts, two-factor authentication codes, and potentially even financial accounts linked to your number.Google Fi's Number Lock acts as a digital safeguard against SIM swapping attempts.Once activated, this feature essentially locks your phone number to your existing SIM card. Any attempts to transfer your number to a new SIM, even through contacting customer service, will be denied unless you disable Number Lock. Enabling this feature provides an extra layer of security, making it significantly harder for fraudsters to hijack your phone number.Activating Number Lock is a simple process. Google Fi users can manage the feature through their online account or the Fi app. Once enabled, you'll receive a confirmation notification, giving you peace of mind that your number is locked and protected.
Article Summary: Google Fi's Number Lock acts as a digital safeguard against SIM swapping attempts. Once activated, this feature essentially locks your phone number to your existing SIM card. Any attempts to transfer your number to a new SIM, even through contacting customer service, will be denied unless you disable Number Lock.

Article Title: Here’s your chance to buy Zomato Gold membership at Rs 30 for 6 months
Article Text:
Zomato Gold benefits



Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma gives a shout-out to Zomato ad

Zomato is celebrating its 16th anniversary this year with an exciting offer on its Gold membership. The food delivery platform has announced an offer to buy Zomato Gold membership for 6 months at just Rs 30. But, there’s an important catch to it. The offer does not work for existing Gold customers. Only those who don’t have a Zomato Gold membership can avail it.Zomato Gold membership gives free delivery on all restaurants within 7km for orders above Rs 199. There is an additional discount of up to 30% above all existing offers at 20,000+ partner restaurants across India.For those unaware, Zomato was originally founded in the year 2008 by Deepinder Goyal and Pankaj Chaddah as FoodieBay. It is headquartered in Gurugram, Haryana and operates in more than 1000 cities across the country.To celebrate its 16th birthday, Zomato has shared an interesting, full page ad in the Times of India newspaper. The ad features a large photograph of its founder and CEO, Deepinder Goyal, along with other top executives. The text, written in Hindi, reads “16th janamdin par aap sabhi ko apna pyar barsane ke liye koti koti dhanyavaad” (On our 16th birthday, a big thanks to all of you for showering us with love).The ad caught the attention of many, including Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma who praised this Zomato ad. Sharing an image of the ad on X (formerly Twitter), Sharma extended his best wishes to Goyal and the entire Zomato team, hoping to see more praiseworthy marketing campaigns in the future.The post is written in Hindi which roughly translates to “On the 16th birthday of Zomato, heartiest congratulations to the chief Mr. Deepinder ji and all the members of his executive! 👏🏼👏🏼May God grant us such praiseworthy advertisements always 🤗.”
Article Summary: Zomato Gold membership gives free delivery on all restaurants within 7km for orders above Rs 199. There is an additional discount of up to 30% above all existing offers at 20,000+ partner restaurants across India. Zomato was originally founded in the year 2008 by Deepinder Goyal and Pankaj Chaddah.
